metadata.title: CVE-2020-27779 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in grub2 in versions prior to 2.06. The cutmem commanddoes not honor secure boot locking allowing an privileged attacker toremove address ranges from memory creating an opportunity to circumventSecureBoot protections after proper triage about grub's memory layout. Thehighest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality andintegrity as well as system availability.

criterions.comment: grub2-signed package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
grub2 package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
